entry.title: Bulletin: a more than marginal boost for Marginal Revolution
entry.summary: We are proud to announce that Marginal Revolution now exists on a second site as well, affiliated with Facebook, at marginalrevolution.bulletin.com. We are excited to be part of this new project, called Bulletin. Please note that marginalrevolution.bulletin.com will be fully free and open, just as the current site is. If you prefer to stay here, […] The post Bulletin: a more than marginal boost for Marginal Revolution appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: Bulletin!
entry.summary: We are thrilled that Marginal Revolution is a featured part of Facebook’s new Bulletin writing service. Facebook has nearly 3 billion active users and this new partnership will bring additional readers to Marginal Revolution. Don’t worry, however, we remain an independent source of news and opinion and Marginal Revolution will continue to exist at Marginal […] The post Bulletin! appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: The Pandemic JOLTS
entry.summary: The 2009 recession was big but it followed a very familiar pattern–job separations were a little bit larger than job hires and this lasted for a little less than year which drove up unemployment rates. Unemployment rates then declined slowly as hires became a little bit larger than separations. Now look at the pandemic recession! […] The post The Pandemic JOLTS appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: *The Dope: The Real History of the Mexican Drug Trade*
entry.summary: That is a new and very useful book by Benjamin T. Smith, oddly it came out first in the UK. Here is one excerpt: Over the past fifty years, to earn the median wage, a Mexican has had to sell an average of 700 grams of marijuana, 18 grams of heroin, or 66 grams of […] The post *The Dope: The Real History of the Mexican Drug Trade* appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: June Eris of the Month 2021: Eris Trojan Horse
entry.summary: Anonymously submitted entry for June Eris of the Month 2021. A burning Troy, the Trojan Horse, and a bad-ass nipple revealing Eris. Ah, when times were simpler. Send us your Eris of the Month Club submissions (more info here) by using the form at the bottom of The MGT. page.

entry.title: There is now actually a book like this
entry.summary: And a very good book at that: My main argument is that Jacob’s approach to urbanism and economics was developed parallel to, and perhaps benefited from, a much broader field of knowledge than is generally understood. Therefore, the chapter considers a wide context, including the revolutionary critique of planning espoused by Alison and Peter Smithson […] The post There is now actually a book like this appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: Sentences to ponder solve for the cycling equilibrium
entry.summary: Austin Cyclists Split On Sharing Bike Lanes With Pizza Delivery Robots Some Austin cyclists are not happy about the robots using bike lanes, while others are optimistic that sharing their path will lead to good things down the road… “My personal view is that I don’t believe these belong in the bike lane,” said Jake […] The post Sentences to ponder solve for the cycling equilibrium appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: The origins of Wokeism
entry.summary: My latest Bloomberg column considers one factor (of many), here is an excerpt: The male-female imbalance in academic life should be treated as a kind of emergency. But the institutions that address it are slow and bureaucratic. Now enter the philosophy of wokeism. One way to think of the woke is as a bunch of […] The post The origins of Wokeism appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: Ann Bernstein interview with Lant Pritchett
entry.summary: Ann Bernstein: From your knowledge of India and Indonesia, what are the core causes of their lack of educational progress? These are places with highly qualified civil servants and, at least in India’s case, a democratic government. How do you see this problem? How do we get out of this trap? Lant Pritchett: I’m head […] The post Ann Bernstein interview with Lant Pritchett appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: *Sweat*
entry.summary: One of the better movies of this year, Sweat (or this review, spoilers in both) focuses on a female Polish Instagram star, and what she has to go through to produce fresh content each day, and how she gets hooked on the income and status of her privileged position. At first it seems like a […] The post *Sweat* appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: Andreessen on Crypto
entry.summary: From Noahpinion’s interview with Marc Andreessen: [C]rypto represents an architectural shift in how technology works and therefore how the world works. That architectural shift is called distributed consensus — the ability for many untrusted participants in a network to establish consistency and trust. This is something the Internet has never had, but now it does, […] The post Andreessen on Crypto appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: The Effect of Adult Entertainment Establishments on Sex Crime
entry.summary: This paper studies how the presence of adult entertainment establishments affects the incidence of sex crimes, including sexual abuse and rape. We build a high frequency daily and weekly panel that combines the exact location of not-self-reported sex crimes with the day of opening and exact location of adult entertainment establishments in New York City. […] The post The Effect of Adult Entertainment Establishments on Sex Crime appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: What I’ve been reading
entry.summary: 1. Ivo Maes, Robert Triffin: A Life. There should be more biographies of economists, and while this one does not succeed in making Triffin exciting, it is thorough and informative and shows there was more to the man than his famous dilemma. I hadn’t even known Triffin was from Belgium. 2. Elizabeth Bowen, The Last […] The post What I’ve been reading appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

entry.title: v1.11.0
entry.summary:
Added: support an experimental template for YouTube feed 📺 Demo | Source
Aggregate content from any YouTube channel rss url https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=<replace_with_channel_id> Videos are embedded via iframe and loading accelerated by youtube-lite-embed Ads are reduced thanks to YouTube's policy for embedded videos 🙃 Works on mobile devices with butter smooth horizontal scroll. Caveat: the template works only with YouTube content. You cannot mix textual RSS feed or other video sources such as Vimeo. Changed: Default HTML template meta tag adjusted to match convention Changed: sources in template data is now ordered by last update timestamp (as opposed to alphabetical) Thank you @PiyushLosalka

entry.title: The Origins of the Thornley/Oswald Manuscript
entry.summary: In his monograph Notes of a Neon Gringo, Kerry Thornley wrote: “When Robert Anton Wilson printed up letterheads for the Bavarian Illuminati, they carried the notice: ‘Safeguard this letter; it may be an important historical document.’ That was very much how I felt about my first little notebook, penned in 1975. I had just begun […]

entry.title: May Eris of the Month 2021: Eris Ἐρις by Matthias Jiury
